str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to eat.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
